src:
Pokémon Spada e Scudo, in un leak le presunte evoluzioni di Grookey e Sobble
02 Nov 2019, 14:38 by Luca Salerno
A poco meno di due settimane dal lancio di Pokémon Spada e Scudo, un utente di Twitter ha diffuso alcune foto delle presunte evoluzioni di due dei tre Pokémon iniziali. La fonte non sembra avere alle spalle altre rivelazioni sulla serie e non c’è nessuna indicazione sul suo grado di affidabilità. Dunque le immagini vanno prese con una certa cautela e meglio chiarire subito che potrebbero rivelarsi degli spoiler se dovessero essere confermate come vere.
Le foto pubblicate dall’utente Twitter “LeakPokemon” mostrano le presunte evoluzioni di due dei tre Pokémon tra i quali il protagonista potrà scegliere il proprio compagno, si tratta di Grookey e Sobble. Ad ogni modo non si potrebbero avere comunque altri riscontri sulle foto dato che l’account responsabile del presunto leak è stato chiuso e che tutti i suoi post e le foto sono state rimosse dal social network.











Leggi anche: WoW Shadowlands riporterà il level cap a 60
La serie dei Pokémon non è estranea ai leak, quasi sempre prima dell’uscita di un gioco molte informazioni arrivano prima della pubblicazione attraverso canali non ufficiali e anche Pokémon Spada e Scudo non fa eccezione. Il gioco sarà rilasciato il 15 novembre prossimo su Switch e segnerà il ritorno di un episodio principale della serie su una console casalinga dopo tanto tempo.
La novità principale sarà rappresentata ovviamente dall’ottava generazione di Pokémon che sarà possibile catturare nel corso dell’avventura ambientata a Galar. La regione in cui è ambientato questo nuovo episodio avrà anche delle zone open world che sarà possibile raggiungere abbastanza presto e permetteranno di affrontare sfide di diverso tipo e diverso grado di difficoltà. Dopo quasi vent’anni, inoltre, il tutorial sulla cattura all’inizio del gioco potrà essere saltato se già  si sarà affrontato con successo un Pokémon prima di parlare con alcuni personaggi non giocabili.
Mancano poco meno di due settimane all’uscita del gioco ma siete ancora tempo per farvi trovare pronti al D1 prenotando su Amazon Pokémon Spada o PokémonScudo.

The razor of negligence, betrayal and defiance of Golestan petrochemical body
Note 2

02 Nov 2019, 14:26

Given the pseudo-betrayal of the then governor of the Golestan Petrochemical field, the neglect of the province's representatives is not forgivable, as the empathy and coherence of the Golestan representatives in Baharistan have also been neglected.
Golestan Petrochemical Company was approved and approved during the first Iranian Presidential trip to Golestan in 2009, and in addition to potential positive economic consequences, social consequences such as people's enthusiasm for prosperity, according to our Golestan News Agency. The region's transformation, employment, and hope for a better life for all Golestan citizens.
As a result, nearly 100,000 people from Gorgan and Golestan provinces bought loans and sold gold, children, loans, and so on. They bought petrochemical stocks and raised over 28 billion tomans to make Golestan a business for the first time. Big and start together.
Under the Ahmadinejad administration, the plan was to create the administrative structure and organization that the Rouhani government came up with, which not only lacked the color of the previous government, but also with major projects such as Mehr housing, equity stakes, subsidies and On a smaller scale, Golestan Petrochemicals came to the forefront.




Hassan Sadeghlu, the first governor of Golestan in the government, can be considered one of the people who have been stubbornly opposed to Golestan Petrochemicals and have repeatedly stated that I do not speak to petrochemicals, as it was during the four-year term of Hasan Sadeghlu's Golestan Petrochemical Company. Was.
After him, Mashhad Hashemi, one of the most important tasks that the governor of Golestan had on the agenda was the Golestan petrochemical debate, but the important and, of course, unanswered question was: What is the difference between two governors of one government dying and one dying? Does he live?
The flood of inter-state petitions (Jahangiri and Tim Kerman) and, of course, the tactical mistake of Hashimi and his absence at the time of the flood, took him to become the Rashti jurist for the Golestan Governor, and he does not yet have a decision on Golestan Petrochemical to undertake this major project. Six years after its approval, it will still end up with some iron bars and a warehouse on the road to Agha Qala.
The interesting point was the childish justification of Hassan Sadeghlou, the governor of Golestan, who said that petrochemical is not justified and is an expensive industry and the resources of the country are scarce and cannot be credited, all the reasons why Andimeshk petrochemical industry is one of them. With over $ 5 million in credits, it was donated, how it was spent, and resources available but no justification for the Golestanis, why in the year 92 Lord and Zanjan became the petrochemicals but not Golestan!
Beyond the betrayal of the governor by the time, the negligence of the representatives of the province of Golestan is not forgivable, the lack of empathy and coherence in the province's representatives and the appointment of their relatives and acquaintances and the preference of personal interests to the interests of the province have made the people of Baharistan neglect petrochemical. .




Perhaps the likes of Asadullah Qarahani, the representative of Ali Abad and a member of the Energy Commission, are more than likely to be in the Golestan Petrochemical Complex because of this important commission and good communication and communication he had with Zanganeh, the oil minister, and several foreign trips. .
Wouldn't this representative have been following up on its implementation because petrochemical was not within the scope of Aliabad constituency?
There are still petrochemicals in the House of Commons these days, where some of the candidates in the province and the country are not considered to be a figure in the provincial and state circles, making more use of the project and giving people hope, while giving hope to the people. They know they can't do anything.
Upcoming elections should teach people to think expertly and expertly in their choices, if they have a petrochemical problem, send someone to parliament who has worked in the oil and gas field and his or her pragmatism and civility have been proven, not the expert on theology to the commission. Send oil and energy to make it work.

Note: Javad Amouzad

End of message /
